net.hudup.listener

Class BindServerList

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.listener.BindServerList

  • public class BindServerList
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the list of bound servers. Each bound server is represented by BindServer class. Note, BindServer contains both the bound server and remote information (host, port, access account, access password, etc.) of such bound server. BindServer can be identified with bound server because it actually is a wrapper of bound server. This class provides utility methods to retrieve and to bind remote servers. This class also supports synchronization mechanism among many threads.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      • getIdleServer

        public BindServer getIdleServer()
        Getting idle remote (bound) server in this list. Note, each bound power server own an internal counter represented by active measure ActiveMeasure interface. ActiveMeasure specifies how to measure the active degree of bound server. The higher active degree is, the more busy the bound server is. So this method returns the less busy bound server in this list.
        Returns:
        idle BindServer in this list.

      • size

        public int size()
        Getting the size of this list, which is the number of bound servers.
        Returns:
        size of this list.

      • unbind

        public void unbind(int index)
        Unbinding the bound server at specified index. Such server is then removed from this list.
        Parameters:
        index - specified index.

      • unbindAll

        public void unbindAll()
        Unbinding and removing all bound servers from this list. After this method is called, this list is empty.

                   int port)
        Finding the bound server by its host and port.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        index of the found BindServer.

      • bind

        public boolean bind(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    java.lang.String account,
                    java.lang.String password,
                    ServerStatusListener bind)
        This method binds a remote server via specified host, port, access account, and access password. If the remote server is already bound, which means that such server already exists in this list, this method firstly unbinds such server and then re-binds such server. The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        host - specified host.
        port - specified port.
        account - specified access account.
        password - specified access password.
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.
        Returns:
        whether bind successfully.

      • rebind

        public boolean rebind(java.lang.String host,
                      int port,
                      java.lang.String account,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      ServerStatusListener bind)
        Firstly, this method unbind all bound servers in this list by calling unbindAll() method, which makes this list empty. Later on this method binds a remote server via specified host, port, access account, and access password. If this method is successful, this list has only one bound BindServer. The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        host - specified host.
        port - specified port.
        account - specified access account.
        password - specified access password.
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.
        Returns:
        whether re-bind successfully.

      • bind

        public boolean bind(RemoteInfo rInfo,
                    ServerStatusListener bind)
        This method binds a remote server via specified remote information which often contains host, port, access account, and access password. If the remote server is already bound, which means that such server already exists in this list, this method firstly unbinds such server and then re-binds such server. Actually, this method calls method rebind(String, int, String, String, ServerStatusListener). The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        rInfo - specified remote information.
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.
        Returns:
        whether bind successfully.

      • rebind

        public boolean rebind(RemoteInfo rInfo,
                      ServerStatusListener bind)
        Firstly, this method unbind all bound servers in this list by calling unbindAll() method, which makes this list empty. Later on this method binds a remote server via specified remote information which often contains host, port, access account, and access password. If this method is successful, this list has only one bound BindServer. The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        rInfo - specified remote information.
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.
        Returns:
        whether re-bind successfully.

      • bind

        public void bind(RemoteInfoList rInfoList,
                 ServerStatusListener bind)
        This method binds many remote servers via specified list of RemoteInfo (s). Each RemoteInfo often contains a set of host, port, access account, and access password. If a remote server is already bound, which means that such server already exists in this list, this method firstly unbinds such server and then re-binds such server. The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        rInfoList - specified list of remote information.
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.

      • rebind

        public void rebind(RemoteInfoList rInfoList,
                   ServerStatusListener bind)
        Firstly, this method unbind all bound servers in this list by calling unbindAll() method, which makes this list empty. Later on this method binds many remote servers via specified list of RemoteInfo (s) by calling bind(RemoteInfoList, ServerStatusListener) method. The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        rInfoList - specified list of remote information.
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.

      • prune

        public void prune()
        Unbinding servers that are not running (stopped or paused). As a result, such servers are removed from this list.

                 throws java.lang.Throwable
